FuncDef:
You can run the radius-attribute cmcc-nas-type command to configure the device to encasulate the CMCC-NAS-Type attribute to the authentication request and accounting  packets to be sent to the RADIUS server.
You can run the undo radius-attribute cmcc-nas-type command to disable the device from encapsulating the CMCC-NAS-Type attribute to the authentication request and accounting packets to be sent to the RADIUS server.
By default, cmcc-nas-type,cmcc-up-identifier and cmcc-up-ip are not sent to the RADIUS server.

ParaDef.Info:
China Mobile-proprietary attibute, used to distinguish between a non-forwarding-control separation device and a forwarding-control separation device.
For a non-CU separation device, the value is 1.For a CU separation device, the value is 2.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable the device to send the CMCC-NAS-Type attribute through Access-Request packets and accounting packets in a scenario where the device is connected to the RADIUS server, run the radius-attribute include cmcc-nas-type command. The attribute helps distinguish non-CU separation devices from CU separation devices. For non-CU separation devices, the value of the CMCC-NAS-Type attribute is 1. For CU separation devices, the value of the CMCC-NAS-Type attribute is 2.
